item.title: Erin add a quote by Hermann Bahr
item.description: "... what we say or do is unimportant; it is merely semblance, beyond which our real life lies concealed... We know this better than we can prove, but in order to prove it we have to express it, and on the path to speech the essential somehow gets lost." -- Hermann Bahr

item.title: Erin add a quote by Henry Brooks Adams
item.description: "No one means all he says, and yet very few say all they mean, for words are slippery and thought is viscous." -- Henry Brooks Adams

item.title: Erin add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Erin add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "You can't plow a field simply by turning it over in your mind." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Erin add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "There is no love sincerer than the love of food." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Erin add a quote by Andre Berthiaume
item.description: "We all wear masks, and the time comes when we cannot remove them without removing some of our own skin." -- Andre Berthiaume

item.title: Erin add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Good books are as friends, willing to give to us if we are willing to make a little effort." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Erin add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "The days aren't discarded or collected, they are bees that burned with sweetness or maddened the sting: the struggle continues, the journeys go and come between honey and pain. No, the net of years doesn't unweave: there is no net. They don't fall drop by drop from a river: there is no river. Sleep doesn't divide life into halves, or action, or silence, or honor: life is like a stone, a single motion, a lonesome bonfire reflected on the leaves, an arrow, only one, slow or swift, a metal that climbs or descends burning in your bones." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Erin add a quote by Benjamin Zander
item.description: "...how absurd human beings are and how magnificent." -- Benjamin Zander
